summary: Allows the player to own a shop and sell items.
descriptionHtml:
[center][b][size=4]The Emporium - BETA[/size][/b][/center]
[center][/center][center][/center]
This mod is heavily inspired by a similar mod for Oblivion that allowed the player to own a shop. I started making in for my own use, but lost interest over time. I'm finally publishing it here in case someone else finds it useful, while I plan to work some more on it in the near future.

It's by no means a finished product - currently, this allows you to purchase a fully decorated and staffed shop in Riften, sell items, view stock ledgers and view items sold. To facilitate merchant/crafting RP, you can also order random raw crafting materials and there is a back room with all the crafting stations. There's also a hidden trapdoor that contains your goods vault. 
[center][b][size=4]
Requirements[/size][/b][/center]
[center]
SKSE, All Expansions[/center][center][b][size=4]
FAQ[/size][/b]

[b]What is this?[/b]

This mod adds a player-owned shop in Riften, accessible from The Ragged Flaggon.

[b]How do I get the shop?[/b]

Speak to Vekel, he will sell you the deed for 5000 gold.

[b][size=2]Why does the shop decor not match The Ragged Flaggon?[/size][/b]

Originally the shop was in Solitude, but I moved it once I started playing a shady character who wanted more of a black market operation. I might redecorate in the future.

[b]How do I run the shop?[/b]


Talk to your business manager, he'll give you a short guidebook. At the back, put items you want to sell in the sell chest. At your desk, find the 'Open/Close Shop' ledger to start/stop selling. Once every 24 hours, some items will be sold (based on your Speech skill) and gold deposited in the profits chest. 
[b][size=2]
[/size][/b][b][size=2]How do I check my stocks?
[/size][/b]
There's a ledger summarising total stock value at current Speechcraft skill and another one with total goods sold. 

[b]How do I order crafting materials?[/b]

For 1000 gold you can order random crafting materials using the ledger near your desk. These will be deposited in the crafting room.

[size=4][b]Known Issues[/b][/size]

<br />Value of enchanted items is not properly calculated by getGoldValue, so enchanted items sell for less than their worth.
